Classical.Structure: A multi-layered neural tissue lining the back of the eye. It is an extension of the CNS. Contains photoreceptor cells (rods/cones) and intrinsically photosensitive retinal ganglion cells (ipRGCs).
Classical.Function: Transduces light (photons) into electrical (L2) signals. Rods/cones handle vision. The ~1% of ipRGCs *non-visually* detect ambient light levels to send a signal to the SCN (D3.Brain.SCN) for circadian entrainment.
Classical.Pathology: Retinal detachment, macular degeneration, retinitis pigmentosa.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: The 'L1 Photon Detector'. The opsin/retinal molecule in photoreceptors performs an L1 quantum event (isomerization) upon absorbing a single L1 photon. (Ref: Paper 1)
SCPN.L2_NeurochemicalNeurological: The 'L2 Transducer'. Converts L1 photon events into an L2 electrical/glutamate signal, which is pre-processed by the retinal layers before being sent to the D3.Brain.Thalamus.
SCPN.L5_OrganismalPsychoemotional: The L2 signals from the retina are the raw data for L5 'visual qualia'.
SCPN.L8_CosmicEntrainment: The 'L8 Sensor'. The ipRGCs are the primary L8 sensors, detecting the L8 solar cycle (light/dark) and sending the entrainment signal to the D3.Brain.SCN.
SCPN.L12_GeomanticTorsional: Hypothesized L12 sensor via cryptochromes in ipRGCs (magnetoreception).

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Window of the Soul'. The physical aperture that translates the outer world of 'Light' (Information) into the inner world of 'Sight' (Consciousness).

Falsification_Hypotheses: H1 (L8 Pathway): In a subject with total rod/cone blindness (no L5 'sight'), the pupillary light reflex and circadian entrainment will be absent. This would falsify the existence of the non-visual 'ipRGC' L8 pathway.

H2 (L5 Pathway): A genetic knockout of ipRGCs (melanopsin) will result in a total loss of L5 visual qualia (blindness), despite intact rods/cones. This would falsify the hypothesis that the L5 and L8 pathways are functionally separate.

H3 (L8 vs L5): Selective stimulation of ipRGCs (using blue light, ~480nm) will fail to produce an L5 'visual qualia' (the subject will not 'see' the light) but will still trigger L8 circadian phase-shifting. This tests the dissociation of the two pathways.
